Job description

We are Chartered Accountants located on St Kilda Road seeking a highly motivated senior accountant with a minimum of 5 years' experience in business services to join the team.


We offer a personalised and highly professional service to an established and select client base. We work closely with our clients to help them achieve their personal, financial and business goals.


We reward performance with a bonus structure tailored to each member of the team


Some of the services we offer include:


Taxation Consulting and Advice

Management accounting

Superannuation (SMSFs)

Business development coaching

Retirement/Succession Planning

Wealth creation Advice

Board of Management Representation

Xero conversion and training

\xa0

This is the ideal role for a motivated individual who wishes to progress their career. You will work closely with the principle and senior manager who will provide you with guidance and support to fastrack your development. \xa0We are looking for someone to 'hit the ground running' and has experience in public practice with cloud based technology including Xero, Class, etc


In return, you will be remunerated commensurate with your experience. You will be trained and challenged to take on value based roles, not just the traditional compliance work. \xa0We are a progressive, paperless and cloud based firm equipped with all the technology to succeed.


We conduct weekly in house training and are constantly searching for ways to develop our staff. \xa0With public transport at our front door and our modern appointed office, you will be joining a team ready to grow with a strong team ethos at heart, which values a good work-life balance.\xa0\xa0

851633117:
[

Machine Learning Specialist

Company Name Silverpond Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 144 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

As a Machine Learning practitioner at Silverpond, your role will include surveying current research and its applicability to business problems, developing new models and adaptation of existing models, designing\xa0metrics and loss functions, and evaluating and reporting on model performance in order to help accelerate the adoption of AI through our product, services, and education.


You will initially work on a client-project involving a large distributed system, combined with several computer vision models. You will help develop these models and evaluate and train them to have acceptable performance for the project. This will be spiked on powerful GPU development boxes in the office (great in winter!) then deployed to the cloud. In addition to the backend data pipelines we need to make the project accessible and intuitive so you will have the opportunity to integrate with user-interfaces as well as management tools.\xa0


There is a great deal of opportunity for ML research decision-making if you wish to take this on - guiding the direction of research and the project, however we also collaborate heavily!


Required Skills:

  • Understanding of current Neural Network state of the art (keep abreast of recent papers, etc.)
  • Strong understanding of\xa0statistical inference
  • Mid-Software engineering skills
  • Ability to program at reasonable scale ~ 50 file projects
  • Version control, unix, async style, cloud understanding
  • Very strong communication and collaboration skills
  • Able to pick up new concepts quickly
  • Tensorflow experience
  • 2 years data-science or machine-learning experience


The following skills are desirable, but not strictly required:

  • Consulting skills
  • Working with clients
  • Analysis in a semi-defensive context
  • Other ML Frameworks - PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow.js
  • Web development skills
  • Containerisation skills
  • Commercial deep-learning experience
  • AWS experience


Silverpond prides itself on ethical applications of AI\xa0and an inclusive workplace. We encourage job applications from Aboriginal people, LGBTI+ and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.

863773589:
[

People & Culture Specialist

Company Name Honda Australia Motor Vehicles Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 133 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

People & Culture Specialist

\xa0

  • Join a passionate team dedicated to delivering a customer orientated People & Culture experience
  • Tullamarine location
  • 12 month maternity leave fixed term contract

\xa0

At Honda Australia, our curiosity about human beings drives us to create products that deliver joy to people’s lives. It is our continual pursuit of dreams, inspiring philosophy, and commitment to customers that establish the spirit of Honda. As a company built on dreams, our associates are passionate and inquisitive, and dedicated to putting the customer at the centre of everything it is we do. We produce some of Australia’s most recognised cars and are backed by a huge global footprint - there really is no company like us. \xa0

\xa0

\xa0

About the Role

Reporting to the People & Culture Manager this is a hands-on role responsible for identifying, developing and retaining the skills that Honda needs to deliver their strategic objectives with a focus on customer experience and continuous improvement.

\xa0

Key Responsibilities

  • Managing employee acquisition: Recruitment Strategy, On-boarding and Induction Program
  • Managing Honda Australia’s recruitment function nationally providing full cycle (end-to-end) best practice specialist recruitment advice
  • Responsible for talent sourcing, identification and selection activities to a level of professionalism appropriate to the Honda brand name
  • Assist in minimising the recruitment budget by delivering an efficient recruitment approach to the business
  • Proactively cultivate meaningful relationships that deliver on what matters most to the business
  • Consult and partner with the business/hiring managers to educate, coach and improve Honda’s overall ability to attract, engage and onboard the right talent
  • Complete strategic projects to drive greater recruitment team effectiveness and efficiency
  • Generate recruitment related reports and provide insight into talent metrics for AUH
  • Implement recruitment approach that enhances deep connection for every new employee
  • Keep the candidate engaged at all stages of the recruitment process and give them a great candidate experience
  • Drive the offer negotiation and manage the onboarding process
  • Managing and negotiating terms and conditions with third party external suppliers (e.g. recruitment agencies, job boards, university and industry bodies)
  • Keeping abreast of industry trends and relevant legislative and compliance matters
  • Provide operational support to the business and team in regards to HR programs, events & activities
  • Assist with general HR activities and processes including reporting and internal project work
  • Participate in communication activities and conduct training to enhance the skills of the AUH team (recruitment or other as discussed and agreed)
  • Contribute to the development of policies and procedures
  • Positively contribute to Health, Safety & Environment through proactive identification and prevention of issues

About you

The successful candidate will have:

\xa0

  • Demonstrated ability to have consistent and positive impact and contribution in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment
  • Proficiency in strategic, proactive, best practice sourcing techniques to include online job boards, social and professional networks in addition to demonstrated ability to source 'beneath the surface' -- targeted sourcing campaigns, targeted networking, headhunting
  • Understanding of organisational development - demonstrated ability to navigate within a matrix organisation to identify and build excellent working relationships with both decision makers and other associates
  • All round team player with a desire to develop skills in HR, including supporting with P&C admin tasks when required
  • Balance of creativity, drive and follow-through along with interpersonal savvy and basic analytics.
  • A passion for human resources and special interest in recruitment

\xa0

Why work for Honda?

Working at Honda you’ll feel a strong sense of pride. It might be the Honda philosophy that our tight-knit team lives and breathes. Or perhaps it’s our strong commitment to enriching lives through the joy of mobility. We respect what makes you an individual and believe everyone is born with the ability to think, create and dream. You’ll work with talented individuals across the business because we believe that through coming together and valuing our ideals, joy is created and ideas are realised. We support our associates in an open, inclusive environment and give each individual the opportunity to realise their dreams. When you join Honda, you’ll be part of a passionate, diverse group who truly enjoy what we do! That’s the Honda way.

\xa0

The joy of moving you is what moves us.

\xa0

Applicants must satisfactorily complete a National Criminal Records check to undertake this role

846436982:
[

Senior Product Designer

Company Name Moose Toys Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 87 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Moose Toys exists to make children happy. The team has innovation in their DNA and are famous for the design, development and manufacture of award winning toys that continue to disrupt the market!

Moose Toys dominates in categories including collectables, craft, dolls, games and youth electronics featuring much loved brands such as: Shopkins, Little Live Pets, Beados, Happy Places, The Grossery Gang, The Trash Pack and Mighty Beanz and is consistently recognised as the most creative company in the industry.

Moose Toys calls Australia home and has teams across Los Angeles, Hong Kong, China, London, Paris and Vietnam, employing more than 350+ staff and distributing to over 100 countries.

Today, Moose Toys is on the hunt for a highly creative and experienced Senior Product Designer - Girls Category.

Role Objective

Responsible for leading design of their own projects, and also for overseeing Product Designers’ work that falls within their allocated category / brand portfolio.

The Senior Product Designer Will Work Closely With The Design Director On All Product Design Aspects Of Allocated Brand Portfolio, Including
  • the progression of an idea to concept approval, always ensuring the product has innovative features;
  • the actual workings of the product including technical design solutions
  • written specifications;
  • program flowchart and play pattern;
  • model and off-tool reviews;
  • ensuring products are designed to meet specific price points; and
  • prioritisation of tasks to ensure timelines are adhered to.

Key Capabilities

Applying Expertise and Technology

In Addition Has

Has functional, practical and technical knowledge of Product Design takes ownership of processes and functions and applies this expertise accordingly. Shares this expertise and knowledge with others.
  • Sound knowledge of products within the toy industry;
  • A solid understanding of (but not limited to) tooling/injection moulding/ moulding of hard goods, plastics - material selection, properties and specification, production and assembly of plastic consumer items, basic QA, printing processes, basic pattern-making, sewing and stitching
  • Basic model making skills, strong sketching skills, an understanding of patents;
  • Excellent computer skills with preferred knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Solidworks;

Creating and Conceptualising Open to new ideas and experiences; Handles problems with innovation and creativity. Produces new ideas, approaches or insights, creates innovative products or designs and able to think in 3D.

Relating and Networking

Develops and maintains positive business partnering and team-based relationships with the Business Unit heads, senior management, other staff and external stakeholders. Relates to others in a confident and relaxed manner.

Achieves personal work goals and objectives

Organises self, people and resources towards the pursuit of objectives, creates a culture of discipline to work unsupervised to complete multiple tasks at any given time to deliver on deadlines. Has an appetite for excellence demonstrating strong attention to detail.

Entrepreneurial and commercial thinking keeps up to date with competitor information and market trends and has a strong interest in social and cultural and fashion trends.

Presenting and Communicating with Impact: Communicate for impact, clarity and connection; Speak fluently; Express opinions, information and key points of an argument clearly; Make effective use of processes to influence and persuade others; Promote ideas on behalf of oneself and others; Make strong personal impact on others; and, Take care to manage one’s impression of others.

Responsibilities
  • Develop innovative, market-leading design concepts for brands within your portfolio that are on-trend, on price, and suitable for production;
  • Provide senior level Product Design guidance and creative input to the allocated brand portfolio;
  • Responsible for reviewing and correcting all Specification documents passing through the Product Design department, ensuring accuracy and consistency across all brand item specifications;
  • Lead and mentor all factors influencing Product Design; costing, selection of materials, production methods, assembly, new technologies, safety/quality assurance, trends, ergonomics, play pattern, etc.
  • Responsible for identifying knowledge gaps and process inefficiencies within the team, and administering training and support;
  • Work with external contractors or inventors to review and develop concepts, ensuring that they are feasible for manufacture;
  • Work with HK project team and vendors to resolve new product introduction issues, ensuring both mechanism design and electronics assembly are tested/validated correctly;
  • Work from our China office and factories at various points throughout Product Development to fast track critical stages and approvals;
  • Work with relevant internal parties to ensure all projects are presented to an acceptably high standard for various Toy Fairs and presentations;
  • Establish standardised documentation deliverables and timelines for items within allocated brand portfolio;
  • Demonstrate the ability to balance and prioritise tasks for all projects within relevant brands; and
  • Ensure that product concepts do not infringe on existing patents or trademarks.

Perks And Benefits

Moose Toys prides itself on valuing team members and constantly pushes for best practice by offering a casual fun environment, great benefits and recognition programs.

Moose Toys recognizes the importance of health and well-being and offers a fully serviced gym, personal training, 30 day challenges and Yoga as well as healthy snacks for the team. We also have “bring your dog to work” each Wednesday and Friday, Children Holiday programs, Veggie patches and the Employee of the Month and Year awards to name a few!

If this role sounds like you please APPLY today!

Relevant tertiary qualification (Product / Industrial Design degree).

Minimum 8 Years’ Experience In a Similar Role.
